item.title: Fallout 4 Fan Shares Stunning Oil Painting of the Red Rocket
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Red Rocket gas station oil painting captures Fallout 4 nostalgia in stunning detail.
  • Players' dedication to Fallout 4 is evident in mods, fan tributes, and continued gameplay.
  • The Red Rocket gas station is memorable due to the early Dogmeat encounter.

A talented Fallout 4 fan online has created an awesome oil painting of the Red Rocket gas station, depicting it as it appears at the beginning of Bethesda's RPG. Most players will encounter the Red Rocket early in their Fallout 4 adventure, making it one of the most recognizable areas from the game.

Despite being released almost a decade ago, Fallout 4 retains an extremely dedicated fanbase online. The game's community continues to play Bethesda's 2015 title, with many using mods to bring it back up to modern standards in its visuals and gameplay. The fact that players still continue to play is impressive, highlighting their love for the game. This dedication often translates to fan tributes online, which arrive in various ways. For example, one creative Fallout fan made their own LEGO power armor set, finding a unique way to bring the series into their real life.

Redditor artace shared their awesome Fallout artwork with the game's community online, depicting the Red Rocket gas station as it appears in Fallout 4 . The details here are incredible, showcasing the first meeting between the Sole Survivor and Dogmeat. Even the colors used perfectly match the color grading seen in Fallout 4 - it's subtle but it makes all the difference. According to the user, this is an oil painting on canvas, which really adds to the texture of the piece.

Fallout 4 Red Rocket Gas Station

For most Fallout 4 players, the Red Rocket gas station is a location they'll stumble across very early in the game. Bethesda designed the game world in a way that tends to lead players in that direction after leaving Sanctuary, meaning it's very difficult to miss. Crucially, it's also where players encounter Dogmeat for the first time, giving players the chance to bring the canine companion along on the adventure. Because of this, it's a popular location for fans of the game, who have paid tribute to it over the years in tons of interesting ways. There was even one Fallout 4 player who created a LEGO version of the Red Rocket gas station.

While gamers are continuing to enjoy Fallout 4 , it's a shame that it seems the wait for a sequel will rage on for a while yet. It's known that Bethesda wants to release games at a quicker rate, although it seems at the moment, there is no plan to diverge from its current plan of actively developing one game at a time. Right now, that game is The Elder Scrolls 6 , meaning Fallout 5 is likely on the backburner for now. Some fans would like to see Bethesda take a New Vegas approach, allowing another studio to take a stab at the IP until it's ready to develop the next mainline entry. However, this seems unlikely at this point.

item.title: Fortnite Remix: All Boss Locations
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Snoop Dogg
    • Found at The Doggpound
  • Meowdas
    • Found at The Yacht
  • Dynamo TNTina
    • Found at The Rig

Fortnite Remix is a nostalgic trip to the past, bringing players back to the Chapter 2 island for a limited time, but with a twist. As players drop from the battle bus in the ultimate Battle Royale of Fortnite , they can actually find a few familiar faces that can be challenged and bested to claim powerful and exclusive loot, as well as a new ally.

With every Fortnite Remix boss coming soon to make a piece of the Chapter 2 island their home, it's best to know just where they are, what they drop, and how best to take care of them so that challenging one doesn't result in returning to the lobby without the illustrious victory royale crown.

More bosses will come to the Fortnite Remix over the next four weeks.

3 Snoop Dogg

Found at The Doggpound

  • Drops Snoop Dogg’s Drum Gun

The Doggpound is the POI found at the center of the Chapter 2 island, and while it replaces The Agency, it still has all the charm of the original, with the added cool factor of Snoop Dogg. The Doggpound houses none other than D-O-Double-G, but don't be fooled by his great music, since this hostile boss will attack on sight.

Snoop Dogg utilizes Stink Bombs and Snoop Dogg's Drum Gun to fight players, but those daring enough to battle him will be rewarded with Dogg's company, joining the player as an unwavering and loyal ally. The Doggpound is a hot spot for action considering its central location on the map, so try to be careful when dropping here.

2 Meowdas

Found at The Yacht

  • Drops the Peow Peow Rifle

The Yacht is found at the top right corner of the Remix map, and inside players can find Meowdas himself, who will purr and hiss his way to victory. That is unless players have weaponry that can rival Meowdas' Peow Peow Rifle. Meowdas also throws some Chug Splashes to help himself and his allies, and players can be that ally if they manage to take Meowdas down.

Meowdas usually roams the bottom deck of the Yacht, so try to be careful when patrolling this area and bring some useful weaponry, since Meowdas isn't going to go down without a fight, and his army of goons will take as many bullets as it takes for their golden kitty boss.

1 Dynamo TNTina

Found at The Rig

  • Drops the Ka-Boom Bow

The very bottom left of the Remix map houses the Rig, a giant oil rig where Dynamo TNTina has made her home. It's a large open space surrounded by a body of water, so players are going to want to drop here from the battle bus and prepare for war against other players brave enough to drop in this desolate location.

Dynamo TNTina has a few agents by her side, and she uses a Ka-Boom bow as well as some Grenades to make for an explosive arsenal. Keep to cover and watch out for rogue players who want to claim her company and her loot.

item.title: The Sims 4: Reaper Career Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Join Reaper Career
  • Reaper Career Daily Tasks
  • Reaper Career Emergency Tasks
  • Weekly Soul Quota
  • Reaper Career Levels and Promotion Requirements

The Life and Death expansion pack for The Sims 4 brings players a unique look at a soul’s journey, from living a fulfilling life to embarking on the final stages of death, introducing funeral events, enhanced ghost mastery abilities, and even options for rebirth. Central to these themes are the two new career paths: Reaper and Undertaker. The Undertaker is a traditional career that progresses through standard work hours, while the Reaper career is an active one, similar to the Scientist or Doctor careers. With the Reaper career, players accompany their Sims to work, guiding them through tasks that contribute to their performance rating, ultimately affecting promotion opportunities.

Unlike many other careers, the Reaper role does not branch into separate paths; instead, it intensifies in complexity as Sims progresses, presenting new and intriguing daily tasks. Skills such as Thanatology , Fitness , and Charisma play an essential role in advancing through the ranks. Notably, Reapers must also help souls transition to the netherworld to earn promotions, and they face a unique weekly quota of 25 souls. Meeting this quota grants access to Grim’s Box , an exclusive reward. Here's an overview of each career level, skill requirements, tasks, and all the essentials players need to master the Reaper career.

How to Join Reaper Career

Starting the Reaper career in The Sims 4 is as straightforward as any other job—players can initiate it by selecting Find a Job to access the career selection menu. Occasionally, however, the Grim Reaper himself may also call Sims to join the ranks of the Reapers. While there are no prerequisites to get started, the career’s darker nature makes it an ideal choice for Sims with the Macabre trait, as these Sims are naturally more inclined to work with the afterlife and will have less debuffs from being near death. Focused moodlet is also ideal when performing tasks.

Reaper Career Daily Tasks

Upon beginning their journey as a “Grimtern,” Sims will need to attend two days of active duty, during which they’ll get a hands-on tutorial that covers the essentials of reaper tasks, preparing them for a successful career. The first day will take players through the usual reaping tasks, including some pre-travel and post-return tasks to be able to complete the reaping procedures.

Pre-Travel Tasks

Sims may need to complete a certain number of tasks before they can actually travel and reap souls. They are relatively straightforward, but should be done as soon as possible so that players have enough time to deal with the tasks as they travel or come back from the reaping. They include:

  • Practice Reaping (By clicking on the mannequin)
  • Perform Scythe Maintenance (Click on the active Sim)
  • Perform Research Assignment (Click on bookshelf)
  • Scry for Travel ( Click Scry Bowl)

On-site Tasks

As Sims progress through the Reaper career, their cases increase in complexity, requiring a variety of tasks before they can successfully collect souls and complete the on-site portion of their workday. At lower career levels, Sims might be assigned to collect just 1-2 souls per day, but as they advance, the number can rise to 4-5 souls (especially with certain emergencies which also allow Sims to skip the pre-travel tasks all together, such as the Cowplant Emergency, or Laughter Disaster), which is helpful for meeting Grim's weekly soul quota. For each case, Sims will first need to identify the cause of death before they can officially reap the soul.

Depending on the circumstances, Sims might need to investigate items near the deceased to uncover clues or even interact with the witnesses. The tasks include:

  • Determine Cause of Death (Click on the deceased Sim to "Investigate Cause of Death" a couple of times, before being able to Determine the Cause of Death"
  • Speak To Witness (Click on any living Sim nearby)
  • Investigate Items (Click on nearby items like chairs or tables)
  • Collect Soul (Click on the deceased Sim)

Players are able to choose between a few options when collecting a soul. The differences are for the most part for some animation variety, however they have different success rates. For example, reaping carefully will take a little longer but will always succeded, but other options have a chance of failing, which might actually cause Sims to take longer time.

  • Ask For Review (Click the urn)
  • Return Urn To Family (Click the urn)
  • Soothe Witness (Click the nearby alive Sim, and find it under the Social Menu)
  • Get To Know Witnesses (Click the nearby alive Sim, and find it under the Friendly Menu)
  • Return To Office (Click on active Sim)

In certain scenarios, players may be prompted to complete a task for the Plea Bargain . In these cases, the active Sim can either choose to accept the Plea (which will then require the reaper Sim to revive the deceased Sim by clicking on them, or otherwise they can reject the plea and reap the soul. While players can essentially choose either of the option, Reviving the Sim will mean they will not be able to collect a soul for the quota, which can make it more difficult to achieve. After choosing either of the options, Sims will be able to return to the office as usual.

Post-Reaping Tasks

There is still more stuff to do after returning from a successful reaping session. They are also quite straightforward, and players should aim to do as many of them as possible until they can get a Gold medal for the day. Other than that, the Sim can simply do any activities that may help them build skills, fill their needs, or release souls to the netherworld, or check the weekly quota for their progress. The tasks include:

  • File Death Certificate (Click the PC. It's recommended to prioritize this task over the others.)
  • Analyse Death Trends (Click the PC)
  • Order Office Supplies (Click the PC)
  • Set Reaping Schedules (Click the Slablet)
  • Socialize with Co-workers ( Click any other Sim on the lot)

Once the working hours are over, players will be able to gain their Simoleons, and see the increase in their performance based on the medal they have obtained.

Reaper Career Emergency Tasks

From time to time, players might find themselves on an Emergency Task at the HQ, which means that they will be unable to be able to reap the souls for a day, but instead complete an entirely different set of tasks at a certain location or at the HQ.

Afterlife Emergency

In this instance, there is something wrong with the Netherworld Portal, and players will simply need to work on fixing it to complete the day. Tasks include:

  • Fix The Scrying Bowl (Click the Scry bowl. Handiness skill can be useful to repair more efficiently)
  • Exorcise The Mischievous Ghost (Find the spirit and use exorcise option. They can be found posessing furniture.)
  • Recalibrate Grim's Slablet (Click on a Slablet)
  • Repair The Netherworld Portal (Click on the Portal. Usually available as the final task for the emergency)

Once these tasks are complete, Sims will be able to do the usual tasks they can perform in the HQ until the end of the work hours.

Collect Lost Souls and Make Grimborsia

In this instance, Sim will need to travel to an empty lot, which is affected by Netherworld Fissures, causing souls to escape to the mortal realm. Sims will be able to skip the pre-travel tasks and travel right away. Tasks include:

  • Harvest Grimbrosia Source (Click the orange plant on the lot)
  • Close Netherworld Fissures (Click the blue-glowing cracks on the floor)
  • Pick Up Lost Souls (Click the floating souls. These will also count towards the weekly quota)
  • Return to the Office
  • Make Grimbrosia (Cook Grimbrosia in the kitchen upstairs at the HQ. Sims will also need to deliver Grimbrosia to the Grim, which will increase their relationship)

Weekly Soul Quota

In the Reaper career, Sims are tasked with collecting a weekly soul quota of 25 souls. This is a combined goal with fellow Reaper colleagues. Meeting this quota is essential not only for maintaining good performance but also for unlocking rewards from Grim's special chest, located upstairs at the HQ. Players can track their Sim's progress toward the quota at any time by using a computer while at HQ, allowing them to plan their tasks accordingly.

Achieving the full quota boosts career performance and provides an additional reward from the chest. On the flip side, failing to reach the quota by week’s end will negatively impact career performance.

Grim will send a notification a day in advance about the weekly soul quota deadline. If players are struggling with reaching the goal in time, they can always buy some additional Lost Souls from the Mysterious Merchant in return for some Simoleons.

Reaper Career Levels and Promotion Requirements

There are a total of 10 levels in the Reaper career. They are as follows:

Level

Hours

Rates

Promotion Requirements

1: Grimtern

9:00am - 5:00pm M T W T F

$25/hour

Attend 2 Active Work Days

2: Restceptionist

9:00am - 5:00pm M T W T F

$31/hour

Reach Level 2 Thanatology Skill

3: Dust-To-Dust Buster

10:00am - 6:00pm M T W T F

$39/hour

Reach Level 3 Thanatology Skill Release 3 Souls * Unlocks Basic Reaper Uniform

4: Collections Agent

2:00pm - 10:00pm T W T F Sat

$54/hour

Reach Level 2 Fitness Skill Reach Level 3 Charisma Skill

5: Soul Slayer

2:00pm - 10:00pm M T W T F Sat

$77/hour

Reach Level 4 Thanatology Skill Release 5 Souls

6: Spirit Expert

(Extraction & Resolution)

11:00am - 7:00pm M T T F Sun

$110/hour

Reach Level 4 Charisma Skill Write Reaping Manual (can be done on Free time on a PC under Writing Menu)

7: Nether-Tether

5:00pm - 1:00am W T F S S

$158/hour

Reach Level 5 Thanatology Skill

8: D.N.R.

(Death's Negotiation Reporter)

2:00pm - 10:00pm T W T S S

$223/hour

Reach Level 4 Fitness Skill Reach Level 5 Charisma Skill * Unlocks Timeless Hourglass (Household Inventory)

9: Graveling

10:00am - 5:00pm M W T F Sun

$299/hour

Release 10 Souls

10: Reaper

9:00am - 4:00pm M W F Sat

$421/hour

N/A * Unlocks Grand Reaper Uniform * Unlocks Grim's Right Hand (Reward Trait)

item.title: New York Times Connections Hints and Answers for #513 November 5, 2024
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #513 for November 5, 2024
  • Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle
  • Answers for Today's NYT Connections #513 for November 5, 2024

Connections is back with another word-sort puzzle to boggle your brain. These sixteen words might seem random at first glance, but they all belong inside four mystery categories. And you don't get a whole lot of guesses to put them in the right locations.

If you already know how to play Connections and are stuck on this puzzle, this article is the perfect companion for your puzzling experience. In it, you can find general hints, category clues, spoilers, and a lot more.

Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #513 for November 5, 2024

The Connections puzzle for today contains the words: Caterpillar, Clam, Mushroom, Kingdom, Turtle, Peach, Egg, Pipe Cleaner, Princess, Marker, Donkey, Carpet, Nut, Dragon, Fleece, and Ogre.

Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle

If you want some hints that won't spoil this mobile puzzle game's answer, each section below has some helpful things. Find the header that matches the type of hint you want to see, then open it up with the Read More button below it.

Some General Hints for the Whole Connections Puzzle

Yellow Connections Category Answer

Yellow Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Green NYT Connections Category Hints

Green Connections Category Answer

Green Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Blue Connections Category Answer

Blue Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Purple NYT Connections Category Hints

Purple Connections Category Answer

Purple Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Answers for Today's NYT Connections #513 for November 5, 2024

Searching for the full answer to this browser-based puzzle game? Open up the expandable section below with the Read More button to see all the categories and what words go into which grouping.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Connections website available on almost any device with a browser.

item.title: How Project Orion Can Improve Cyberpunk 2077's Romance Options
item.description:
Recovering from its difficult launch, Cyberpunk 2077 has grown into a worthy game filled with fascinating characters and lore. Between last year's game-changing 2.0 update and the Phantom Liberty DLC, Cyberpunk 2077 has proven itself as a sci-fi epic. Now that a sequel is officially underway, codenamed Project Orion, many questions surrounding the follow-up have revolved around how it will improve upon its predecessor.

Despite its impressive upgrades, Cyberpunk 2077 still has room to grow, which is what makes a sequel such an exciting prospect. There are a variety of ways that immersion can be brought to greater heights in Project Orion, and one of the most effective improvements that should be at the forefront is found in the game's romance options. Cyberpunk 2077 offers several romantic relationships to be formed with specific NPCs, but when it comes to the RPG genre, the options are lacking.

How Project Orion Can Improve Cyberpunk 2077's Romance Options

More NPC Romance Options Are a Must

Although there are a variety of brief romantic encounters V can have with characters and Joytoys, there are only four NPCs to choose from when it comes to forming an actual relationship. Cyberpunk 2077 's romance options being kept to just four characters arguably helps keep the game's story more concise, but it can also be a point of frustration.

  • Judy Alvarez
  • Panam Palmer
  • River Ward
  • Kerry Eurodyne

When comparing Cyberpunk 2077 to the likes of Baldur's Gate 3 , it's clear that the former needs to improve on its romance options. The four characters offered as relationship possibilities are all compelling in their own right, but at least doubling the number of NPCs in Project Orion would make this aspect of role-playing far stronger.

Finishing the side quests for these four romance options opens up their apartments, allowing V to visit.

Making Romanceable NPCs Less Restrictive

Another downside of Cyberpunk 2077 's romance options is that they are incredibly restrictive. Depending on whether players choose a feminine or masculine version of V, one's choices are restricted even further. For example, Judy Alvarez will only romance a version of V with a feminine body and voice. On the one hand, this can help establish the personality and story of NPCs in an effective way, but it can also take away from one's desire to live whatever life they wish in Night City. Baldur's Gate 3 balances its relationship restrictions quite well. Players can romance characters regardless of orientation and gender, but some characters are open to polyamorous relationships, while others are monogamous.

Project Orion Bringing Cyberpunk 2077 to the Next Level

Building a Life in Night City

Building relationships in Cyberpunk 2077 can have its challenges, but getting more freedom in Project Orion would only make the world of Night City feel that much more realistic in the long run. Since the game is still in its very early stages of development, it will likely be a long time before more news about the sequel comes to light. However, when that day finally comes, it will be fascinating to finally get a glimpse at how CD Projekt Red goes about making a follow-up stand out while still retaining the first game's energy.

Joytoys will sleep with V regardless of gender, but players can't build deep relationships with them.

After a long and rocky road, Cyberpunk 2077 has finally become a beloved RPG. This may mean that expectations are high for Project Orion, but CD Projekt Red at least had an opportunity to hopefully learn from initial mistakes. Bouncing back from a controversial launch the way Cyberpunk 2077 did is not an easy task, and now that developers have extra knowledge under their belts, Project Orion has the chance to go even bigger with many of its concepts. In that regard, romance options are a great starting point.
